facts: The Ten Commandments are a set of rules in the Bible that teach people how to live and treat others fairly.
In the book of Exodus, Moses receives the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai after the Israelites leave Egypt.
The commandments are traditionally grouped into duties toward God, like worship and respect, and duties toward people, like honesty and kindness.
The commandments include moral rules such as not stealing, not lying, and not killing, which help protect communities from harm.
Keeping the Sabbath, one of the commandments, is about setting aside regular time for rest and worship.
The commandments also teach respect for family, including honoring oneâ€™s father and mother.
The Ten Commandments appear in two Bible passages, Exodus 20 and Deuteronomy 5, with very similar wording.
